page.title: 01AFTER THE PIT CLOSURES
page.content: Forth, formerly a mining community now has about 3000 inhabitants. There is little local employment. Housing is mainly updated local authority. Private sector is increasing. Village life remains healthy with numerous and varied organisations for all ages local churches are well attended. Youth organisations are fortunate in their leaders notably a long established Boys Brigade. Mortality and morbidity are average since the disappearance of mining. the surrounding area is farmland with some moss, averaging Â£700/acre. Communications are poor, an indifferent bus service is all the public transport. The village has changed from a settled tight knit mining community to a mixed community with some 'incomers'.
